issue.title: Course notices being displayed on the Courses page
issue.body: ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Create a course. 2. Set another course as course prerequisite. 3. Go to the courses page (courses overview) on the frontend. ### What I Expected To not see the prerequisite notice, since I'm not on the course page. ### What Happened Instead I see the prerequisite notice of the course. ### PHP / WordPress / Sensei LMS version PHP 7.4 / WP 6.3 / Sensei 4.18.0. ### Browser / OS version Chrome / Mac OSX ### Screenshot / Video ### Context / Source I noticed it while working on https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/pull/7231 which introduces another course notice. So I imagine it gets more critical now since the users will see it while testing the new feature.

issue.title: Change to includes/class-sensei-question.php file broke TranslatePress translations of question title
issue.body:
<!-- Thanks for contributing to Sensei LMS! Pick a clear title ("Lesson: Show complexity in individual lessons") and proceed. -->

### Steps to Reproduce

After updating from 4.16.1 to 4.18.0, the translation of quiz questions is no longer working (latest version of TranslatePress installed with manual translations). If we remove the new line (673) in /includes/class-sensei-question the translations again appear. Here is that line for reference:

$title_html .= sprintf( esc_html__( '%d. ', 'sensei-lms' ), sensei_get_the_question_number() );

### PHP / WordPress / Sensei LMS version

PHP 7.4.33 but confirmed it also exists in 8.2.11, WordPress version 6.3.2

![Screenshot 2023-10-24 at 2 50 47 PM](https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/assets/19677993/0809fba0-1454-4de1-b0f2-375bf248695b)

issue.title: CGPA calculation/Display and Moodle Integration
issue.body:
<!-- Thanks for contributing to Sensei LMS! Pick a clear title ("Lesson: Show complexity in individual lessons") and proceed. -->

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe
No, it is not related to any problem per se. But in a way, the lack of some features can be a problem. For colleges and universities, students need to see their performance report. This performance report must include getting their commutative grade across courses. So far, I have not seen a plugin that is capable of doing that. Therefore, it is greatly appreciated, but it is also going to be a game-changer since most custom-built student portals are very slow.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Either by upgrading the core plugin or by building a separate block or add-on, create a grade book that is capable of calculating and displaying CGPA across courses. Or please consider building an entirely new plugin for the student information system.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
An alternative is to build an entirely new plugin for a student information system (SIS). I have tried to research the area a little bit, and I haven't found any WP plugin that is used to build SIS with CGPA calculation. I have even contacted some plugin developers, and they just mentioned they do not have the feature.

### Additional context
Most colleges use separate LMS and SIS that are integrated with APIs.

forkee.name: sensei
forkee.description: Sensei LMS - Online Courses, Quizzes, & Learning

issue.title: Allow styling lesson action buttons in learning mode
issue.body:
Resolves https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/issues/7088

## Proposed Changes
Enabled using Lesson Actions block in learning mode.

In learning mode, we were using the learning mode-specific `course-theme-lesson-actions` block. This block didn't allow many customizations, especially lacked button customizability which resulted in many users facing issues with styling it as it was possible to style them only using CSS.

Here we have made some changes to the Lesson Actions block and used that instead in learning mode. As this block is a variation of the core button blocks, it has all the customizability and behavior of buttons. Based on the number of ZD tickets in the reference comments of the issue, looks like this is the number one most awaited feature improvement :p

Note: We don't have the Checked icon in the Completed button and Right arrow in next lesson now. As SVG is not supported as inline image inside buttons. We could programmatically add them, but we want these buttons to be fully customizable by the user and keep the buttons as close to Core buttons as possible to prevent unwanted issues with themes.

## Testing Instructions
<!--
Add as many details as possible to help others reproduce the issue and test the changes.
"Before / After" screenshots can also be very helpful when the change is visual.
-->

1. Make sure you do not have any saved version of the (Learning Mode - Default) template in site editor. otherwise you will not find these changes.
2. Create a course with many lessons, some with quizzes, some without.
3. Take some quizzes, complete some lessons, keep some quizzes awaiting grade, complete some quizzes.
4. Make sure in each of those scenarios, the button colors, shapes and texts match the previous LM buttons (except for dynamic color changes, because you can't do it from block editor)
5. Check with different themes, block and non block themes.
6. Check in mobile view.
7. Check without learning mode as well.

#### Screenshots
Course Theme:
![Screenshot 2023-10-19 at 8 41 42 AM](https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/assets/6820724/f0940823-32ae-4921-a681-9df208550a34)

Color customized in Divi:
![Screenshot 2023-10-19 at 8 43 39 AM](https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/assets/6820724/ec5a3c40-e7eb-4643-8ed6-428b8967bf67)

Mobile view:
![Screenshot 2023-10-19 at 8 45 17 AM](https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/assets/6820724/ca36e4e7-49d7-4f99-90bf-2f2b2f50cbd7)

## Pre-Merge Checklist
<!-- Complete applicable items on this checklist **before** merging. Items that are not applicable can be left unchecked.

Both the PR author and reviewer are responsible for ensuring the checklist is completed. -->
- [ ] PR title and description contain sufficient detail and accurately describe the changes
- [ ] Acceptance criteria is met
- [ ] Decisions are publicly documented
- [ ] Adheres to coding standards ([PHP](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/php/), [JavaScript](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/javascript/), [CSS](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/css/), [HTML](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/html/))
- [ ] All strings are translatable (without concatenation, handles plurals)
- [ ] Follows our naming conventions (P6rkRX-4oA-p2)
- [ ] Hooks (p6rkRX-1uS-p2) and functions are documented
- [ ] New UIs are responsive and use a [mobile-first approach](https://zellwk.com/blog/how-to-write-mobile-first-css/)
- [ ] New UIs match the designs
- [ ] Different user privileges (admin, teacher, subscriber) are tested as appropriate
- [ ] Code is tested on the minimum supported PHP and WordPress versions
- [ ] User interface changes have been tested on the latest versions of Chrome, Firefox and Safari
- [ ] "Needs Documentation" label is added if this change requires updates to documentation
- [ ] Known issues are created as new GitHub issues

comment.body:
> 1. Is it something you wrote and then changed the approach later? If yes, the variations approach wasn't possible?

Hi @renatho 👋 Oh right, it was from a earlier thought of mine. But changed later. I'm changing the description. I decided to reuse the current Lesson Actions block we have. because otherwise we'd make a lot of things ground up. And as the buttons have a lot of functionalities handled programmatically in the frontend, it made more sense to use the same way other buttons are created. Because, otherwise we'd need to overwrite the whole frontend content to be rendered by the core button block.

I actually went for the 'bonus' way as mentioned in the issue :p
`It would be a bonus if we could somehow reuse the [existing Lesson Actions block](https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/tree/trunk/assets/blocks/lesson-actions) that we use when Learning Mode is disabled.`

> Is your plan to come with another PR in Sensei Pro to change the blocks of the premium templates?

You are absolutely right, we didn't make substantial changes to the premium templates recently, for example, we didn't work on them for Contact Teacher, Questions and Quiz style projects. Applying these changes would also require converting the templates from  HTML to PHP because we'll need to support translations. I'll create an issue for the pro templates and link it here.

Thanks so much for looking into it.

comment.body:
Hey @Imran92! Thank you for working on this issue! It seems to be a very important one for the users!

Before doing a complete review, I'd like to ask you 2 questions:

1. About the approach

    > Here we have made some changes to the Lesson Actions block and used that instead in learning mode. As this block is a variation of the core button blocks, it has all the customizability and behavior of buttons.
    
    Is it something you wrote and then changed the approach later? If yes, the variations approach wasn't possible?
2. Is your plan to come with another PR in Sensei Pro to change the blocks of the premium templates?
I notice that some dependency with styles is not being loaded on this page when using TT3, which makes the buttons a little weird. If I include any button to the page, it gets fixed.

pull_request.title: Style the "Your Grade" notice
pull_request.body:
Resolves #7102.

## Proposed Changes
- Updates the styles for the "Your Grade" notice on the quiz page.
- Leveraged the code from #7202 so that the buttons in the notice and the footer use the same markup.
- Also refactored the markup so that it returns the same HTML as a WordPress button.

## Testing Instructions
<!--
Add as many details as possible to help others reproduce the issue and test the changes.
"Before / After" screenshots can also be very helpful when the change is visual.
-->

Please see the acceptance criteria in #7102. Test on the Course theme as well as a non-block theme.

## Pre-Merge Checklist
<!-- Complete applicable items on this checklist **before** merging. Items that are not applicable can be left unchecked.

Both the PR author and reviewer are responsible for ensuring the checklist is completed. -->

- [x] Acceptance criteria is met
- [x] Decisions are publicly documented
- [x] Adheres to coding standards ([PHP](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/php/), [JavaScript](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/javascript/), [CSS](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/css/), [HTML](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/html/))
- [x] All strings are translatable (without concatenation, handles plurals)
- [x] Follows our naming conventions (P6rkRX-4oA-p2)
- [ ] Hooks (p6rkRX-1uS-p2) and functions are documented
- [x] New UIs are responsive and use a [mobile-first approach](https://zellwk.com/blog/how-to-write-mobile-first-css/)
- [x] New UIs match the designs
- [ ] Different user privileges (admin, teacher, subscriber) are tested as appropriate
- [x] Code is tested on the minimum supported PHP and WordPress versions

- [ ] "Needs Documentation" label is added if this change requires updates to documentation
- [ ] Known issues are created as new GitHub issues

pull_request.title: Style the "Awaiting Grade" notice
pull_request.body:
Resolves https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/issues/7074.

## Proposed Changes
- Updates the styles for the "Awaiting Grade" notice on the quiz page.
- Although the scope was only for the notice on the quiz page, I also updated just the colors of the "Awaiting Grade" notice on the lesson page. Since I broke it with my changes, the easiest fix was to match the colors. Matching the fonts would also be nice for consistency's sake, but that is outside the scope of this PR.
- Unfortunately, the HTML of the _Pending Teacher Grade_ and the _Restart Quiz_ link in the notice and in the quiz footer are different. We probably should have synced up better on this one. Perhaps one day soon we'll be able to match the markup and use common styles. 🙏🏻 
- Made a change to ensure the third-party theme's `learning-mode.css` file loads after the generic Sensei one. Now we won't have to make theme CSS selectors more specific than the default selectors in order to override them. Instead, we just need to match them, and the styles loaded last (i.e. the theme's styles) win.

## Testing Instructions
<!--
Add as many details as possible to help others reproduce the issue and test the changes.
"Before / After" screenshots can also be very helpful when the change is visual.
-->

1. Activate Divi or Astra.
2. Add a quiz to a lesson and ensure that quiz is *not* set to auto-grade.
3. Take the course as a student.
4. View the "Awaiting grade" notice on the quiz page and ensure it matches the design.
5. Verify that the colors of the "Awaiting grade" notice on the lesson page matches that of the quiz page (it's expected that the fonts won't match).
6. Test on mobile as well.
7. Check out this branch - https://github.com/Automattic/themes/pull/7401.
8. Activate the Course theme.
9. Repeat steps 4 & 5 for all style variations.
10. Disable the Quiz Graded email and view the notice again.
11. Verify that "You’ll receive an email once it’s ready to view." is no longer part of the message.
12. Bonus: Disable the `email_customization` feature flag and repeat step 11.

## Pre-Merge Checklist
<!-- Complete applicable items on this checklist **before** merging. Items that are not applicable can be left unchecked.

Both the PR author and reviewer are responsible for ensuring the checklist is completed. -->
- [x] PR title and description contain sufficient detail and accurately describe the changes
- [x] Acceptance criteria is met
- [x] Decisions are publicly documented
- [x] Adheres to coding standards ([PHP](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/php/), [JavaScript](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/javascript/), [CSS](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/css/), [HTML](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/html/))
- [x] All strings are translatable (without concatenation, handles plurals)
- [x] Follows our naming conventions (P6rkRX-4oA-p2)
- [ ] Hooks (p6rkRX-1uS-p2) and functions are documented
- [x] New UIs are responsive and use a [mobile-first approach](https://zellwk.com/blog/how-to-write-mobile-first-css/)
- [x] New UIs match the designs
- [ ] Different user privileges (admin, teacher, subscriber) are tested as appropriate
- [x] Code is tested on the minimum supported PHP and WordPress versions
- [x] User interface changes have been tested on the latest versions of Chrome, Firefox and Safari
- [ ] "Needs Documentation" label is added if this change requires updates to documentation
- [ ] Known issues are created as new GitHub issues

pull_request.title: Style the "Awaiting Grade" notice
pull_request.body:
Resolves https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/issues/7074.

## Proposed Changes
- Updates the styles for the "Awaiting Grade" notice on the quiz page.
- Although the scope was only for the notice on the quiz page, I also updated just the colors of the "Awaiting Grade" notice on the lesson page. Since I broke it with my changes, the easiest fix was to match the colors. Matching the fonts would also be nice for consistency's sake, but that is outside the scope of this PR.
- Unfortunately, the HTML of the _Pending Teacher Grade_ and the _Restart Quiz_ link in the notice and in the quiz footer are different. We probably should have synced up better on this one. Perhaps one day soon we'll be able to match the markup and use common styles. 🙏🏻 
- Made a change to ensure the third-party theme's `learning-mode.css` file loads after the generic Sensei one. Now we won't have to make theme CSS selectors more specific than the default selectors in order to override them. Instead, we just need to match them, and the styles loaded last (i.e. the theme's styles) win.

## Testing Instructions
<!--
Add as many details as possible to help others reproduce the issue and test the changes.
"Before / After" screenshots can also be very helpful when the change is visual.
-->

1. Activate Divi or Astra.
2. Add a quiz to a lesson and ensure that quiz is *not* set to auto-grade.
3. Take the course as a student.
4. View the "Awaiting grade" notice on the quiz page and ensure it matches the design.
5. Verify that the colors of the "Awaiting grade" notice on the lesson page matches that of the quiz page (it's expected that the fonts won't match).
6. Test on mobile as well.
7. Check out this branch - https://github.com/Automattic/themes/pull/7401.
8. Activate the Course theme.
9. Repeat steps 4 & 5 for all style variations.
10. Disable the Quiz Graded email and view the notice again.
11. Verify that "You’ll receive an email once it’s ready to view." is no longer part of the message.
12. Bonus: Disable the `email_customization` feature flag and repeat step 11.

## Pre-Merge Checklist
<!-- Complete applicable items on this checklist **before** merging. Items that are not applicable can be left unchecked.

Both the PR author and reviewer are responsible for ensuring the checklist is completed. -->
- [x] PR title and description contain sufficient detail and accurately describe the changes
- [x] Acceptance criteria is met
- [x] Decisions are publicly documented
- [x] Adheres to coding standards ([PHP](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/php/), [JavaScript](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/javascript/), [CSS](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/css/), [HTML](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/html/))
- [x] All strings are translatable (without concatenation, handles plurals)
- [x] Follows our naming conventions (P6rkRX-4oA-p2)
- [ ] Hooks (p6rkRX-1uS-p2) and functions are documented
- [x] New UIs are responsive and use a [mobile-first approach](https://zellwk.com/blog/how-to-write-mobile-first-css/)
- [x] New UIs match the designs

issue.title: Style footer of multi-page quiz in Learning Mode
issue.body:
<!-- Thanks for contributing to Sensei LMS! Pick a clear title ("Lesson: Show complexity in individual lessons") and proceed. -->

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Add a multi-page quiz to a lesson.
2. Select the _Allow Retakes_ checkbox.
3. As a student, view the quiz on the frontend.
4. Scroll to the footer.

### What I Expected
The footer to be styled the same as it is for a single page quiz.

### What Happened Instead
The footer is very different from the footer for a single page quiz:
- The _Next_ button to be on the left and the links on the right.
- The font sizes of _Reset_, _Save_ and the page numbers are too small. They should all be the same size.
- _Reset_ should be _Restart Quiz_.
- _Save_ should be _Save Progress_.

### Screenshot / Video
#### Course Theme - Current
![Screenshot 2023-10-20 at 2 21 35 PM](https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/assets/1190420/317f2f17-1d60-4f2b-a542-f441e181af32)

#### Course Theme - Desired
![Screenshot 2023-10-20 at 2 16 20 PM](https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/assets/1190420/618bbb9a-2d07-4476-9fb2-3598f6586a68)

pull_request.title: Add progress validation command
pull_request.body:
Resolves #7079

## Proposed Changes
* Add a WP CLI command that validates the migrated progress data.
* Fixes quiz progress not migrating when multiple users have progress on the same quiz.

## Testing Instructions
<!--
Add as many details as possible to help others reproduce the issue and test the changes.
"Before / After" screenshots can also be very helpful when the change is visual.
-->

1. Enable the HPPS feature `add_filter( 'sensei_feature_flag_tables_based_progress', '__return_true' );`.
2. Run the student progress migration following the testing instructions at https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/pull/7049.
3. Run the following command in your WordPress folder: `wp sensei db validate progress`.
4. You should see `Success: Progress data is valid.`.
5. Try deleting a progress entry in your `wp_sensei_lms_progress` table.
6. You should see a `Course/Lesson/Quiz tables based progress not found` error.
7. Try changing the progress status in your `wp_sensei_lms_progress` table.
8. You should see a `Data mismatch between comments and tables based progress.` error.


## Pre-Merge Checklist
<!-- Complete applicable items on this checklist **before** merging. Items that are not applicable can be left unchecked.

Both the PR author and reviewer are responsible for ensuring the checklist is completed. -->
- [x] PR title and description contain sufficient detail and accurately describe the changes
- [x] Acceptance criteria is met
- [x] Decisions are publicly documented
- [x] Adheres to coding standards ([PHP](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/php/), [JavaScript](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/javascript/), [CSS](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/css/), [HTML](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/html/))
- [x] All strings are translatable (without concatenation, handles plurals)
- [x] Follows our naming conventions (P6rkRX-4oA-p2)
- [x] Hooks (p6rkRX-1uS-p2) and functions are documented
- [x] New UIs are responsive and use a [mobile-first approach](https://zellwk.com/blog/how-to-write-mobile-first-css/)
- [x] New UIs match the designs
- [x] Different user privileges (admin, teacher, subscriber) are tested as appropriate
- [x] Code is tested on the minimum supported PHP and WordPress versions
- [x] User interface changes have been tested on the latest versions of Chrome, Firefox and Safari
- [x] "Needs Documentation" label is added if this change requires updates to documentation
- [x] Known issues are created as new GitHub issues

commits.message: Add a progress table eraser tool
The tool is visible only when the feature is disabled
Use local method to get progress tables
Redirect to the tools page when tables deleted

Merge pull request #7230 from Automattic/add/progress-tables-eraser

Add a progress table eraser tool

issue.title: Create a tool that deletes the new progress tables
issue.body:
# Goal

We need a tool (Sensei LMS -> Tools) that removes the newly created progress custom tables. 

## Scope

- Create a new tool in Sensei LMS -> Tools.
- The tool should always be visible but the action button should be disabled if the progress tables feature is enabled.
  - Another approach is to show the tool only when the feature is enabled but disable the feature once the tables have been deleted. LMKWYT.
- There should be a description that explains that deleting the tables can only be done when the progress tables feature is disabled.
- There should be an action button that runs the process. Once clicked, there should be a confirmation popup because this is a destructive action.

pull_request.title: Add a progress table eraser tool
pull_request.body:
Resolves #5868 

## Proposed Changes

* Add a tool that deletes progress tables and quiz submission tables.

## Testing Instructions

1. Enable the feature flag. 
3. Make sure you have progress tables in DB. If not remove the `sensei-version` option from `wp_options` table and reload a page (it should run schema update and create tables).
4. Make sure you don't see the tool ("Delete student progress tables").
5. Disable the feature flag.
6. Take a course and submit a quiz to have some rows in tables.
7. Go to Sensei LMS > Tools.
8. Find `Delete student progress tables`, click "Visit Tool".
9. On the next screen, try to click "Delete Progress Tables" without giving your confirmation.
10. Must not delete tables, shows a warning.
11. Now check the confirmation and click "Delete Progress Tables".
12. Make sure tables were deleted.
13. Go to Tools and check the tool is not available. (You can see it, but the "Visit Tool" button is disabled.)

## Pre-Merge Checklist
<!-- Complete applicable items on this checklist **before** merging. Items that are not applicable can be left unchecked.

Both the PR author and reviewer are responsible for ensuring the checklist is completed. -->
- [x] PR title and description contain sufficient detail and accurately describe the changes
- [ ] Acceptance criteria is met
- [x] Decisions are publicly documented
- [ ] Adheres to coding standards ([PHP](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/php/), [JavaScript](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/javascript/), [CSS](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/css/), [HTML](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/html/))
- [ ] All strings are translatable (without concatenation, handles plurals)
- [ ] Follows our naming conventions (P6rkRX-4oA-p2)
- [ ] Hooks (p6rkRX-1uS-p2) and functions are documented
- [ ] New UIs are responsive and use a [mobile-first approach](https://zellwk.com/blog/how-to-write-mobile-first-css/)
- [ ] New UIs match the designs
- [ ] Different user privileges (admin, teacher, subscriber) are tested as appropriate
- [ ] Code is tested on the minimum supported PHP and WordPress versions
- [ ] User interface changes have been tested on the latest versions of Chrome, Firefox and Safari
- [ ] "Needs Documentation" label is added if this change requires updates to documentation
- [ ] Known issues are created as new GitHub issues

issue.title: Add course theme variation body class
issue.body:
## Proposed Changes
* We've added a custom property in Course theme's theme json and the json setting of the variations as well. Here we parse the property value and add that to the body class. This will allow us to style the variations using CSS directly instead of having to write them in json files as strings.

## Testing Instructions
<!--
Add as many details as possible to help others reproduce the issue and test the changes.
"Before / After" screenshots can also be very helpful when the change is visual.
-->

1. Checkout this branch of Course theme https://github.com/Automattic/themes/pull/7432
2. Select a variation of Course theme for your site from site editor and save
3. Reload from the frontend
4. Make sure the body element has the class `course-theme-variation-`[default/blue/gold/dark]
5. Check for all variations
6. Check with another block and non block theme to make sure nothing is broken

![Screenshot 2023-10-17 at 10 04 39 PM](https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/assets/6820724/b12a1e5d-83ce-494d-8050-5d380976ede3)

## Pre-Merge Checklist
<!-- Complete applicable items on this checklist **before** merging. Items that are not applicable can be left unchecked.

Both the PR author and reviewer are responsible for ensuring the checklist is completed. -->
- [x] PR title and description contain sufficient detail and accurately describe the changes
- [x] Acceptance criteria is met
- [x] Decisions are publicly documented
- [x] Adheres to coding standards ([PHP](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/php/), [JavaScript](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/javascript/), [CSS](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/css/), [HTML](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/html/))
- [ ] All strings are translatable (without concatenation, handles plurals)
- [x] Follows our naming conventions (P6rkRX-4oA-p2)
- [ ] Hooks (p6rkRX-1uS-p2) and functions are documented
- [ ] New UIs are responsive and use a [mobile-first approach](https://zellwk.com/blog/how-to-write-mobile-first-css/)
- [x] New UIs match the designs
- [ ] Different user privileges (admin, teacher, subscriber) are tested as appropriate
- [x] Code is tested on the minimum supported PHP and WordPress versions
- [ ] User interface changes have been tested on the latest versions of Chrome, Firefox and Safari
- [ ] "Needs Documentation" label is added if this change requires updates to documentation
- [ ] Known issues are created as new GitHub issues

comment.body:
Thanks so much for for going through the PR again. I've addressed the remaining comments too ☺️ 

> but probably better to do so in a separate PR to keep this one clean, or just create a new issue.

Thanks, I'll create a new issue for it.

> I don't quite follow this bit. The CSS we're loading there is for Learning Mode, which is part of Sensei, so for me it doesn't make sense to put it in Course.

Sorry I didn't explain it better, it's just a thought I wanted to share, nothing I'm too sure about or inclined to.

Variation-specific CSS styles can need to be written for any block, for the core blocks too. The course theme can be used without Sensei too. For example, let's say we have to write some CSS which is different for every variation of the Course theme for the Query Loop block. So if the course theme itself adds the body class (we move the `maybe_add_course_theme_variation_class` function to the Course repo PR), then we won't need to write the CSS for the Query Loop block in each theme.json, rather we can just write the CSS for the query loop block [here](https://github.com/Automattic/themes/blob/trunk/course/style.css) targeting the body class of the variation. And from Sensei, we need to just target the body class. Also, maybe we can share our workaround with the theme team too in that case if you think it can be useful. WDYT?

> We should probably add this closer to the functionality that uses it, maybe in the Sensei_Course_Theme class.

Agreed, just to share why I'm hesitating a bit to do it and see if you feel it can be valid, even though most of our custom CSS are learning mode specific, we also do add styles for non learning mode state too, because Course theme variation styles are applied to the whole site, even out of learning mode. For example, here we have added some styles for quiz questions https://github.com/Automattic/themes/blob/dafe8da4ade2a571ff068487a7f1214c7aac3158/course/styles/gold.json#L308, these styles are meant to be applied on questions even out of learning mode. But `Sensei_Course_Theme` class is for learning mode only. WDYT?

comment.body:
Thanks, Miro. Fixed it here: https://github.com/Automattic/sensei/pull/7230/commits/4299161b35697503f8c42ddff9fa53947b247cad

I redirect to the Tools page when tables were deleted.

pull_request.title: Add a progress table eraser tool
pull_request.body:
Resolves #5868 

## Proposed Changes

* Add a tool that deletes progress tables and quiz submission tables.

## Testing Instructions

1. Enable the feature flag. 
3. Make sure you have progress tables in DB. If not remove the `sensei-version` option from `wp_options` table and reload a page (it should run schema update and create tables).
4. Make sure you don't see the tool ("Delete student progress tables").
5. Disable the feature flag.
6. Take a course and submit a quiz to have some rows in tables.
7. Go to Sensei LMS > Tools.
8. Find `Delete student progress tables`, click "Visit Tool".
9. On the next screen, try to click "Delete Progress Tables" without giving your confirmation.
10. Must not delete tables, shows a warning.
11. Now check the confirmation and click "Delete Progress Tables".
12. Make sure tables were deleted.
13. Go to Tools and check the tool is not available. (You can see it, but the "Visit Tool" button is disabled.)

## Pre-Merge Checklist
<!-- Complete applicable items on this checklist **before** merging. Items that are not applicable can be left unchecked.

Both the PR author and reviewer are responsible for ensuring the checklist is completed. -->
- [x] PR title and description contain sufficient detail and accurately describe the changes
- [ ] Acceptance criteria is met
- [x] Decisions are publicly documented
- [ ] Adheres to coding standards ([PHP](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/php/), [JavaScript](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/javascript/), [CSS](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/css/), [HTML](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/html/))
- [ ] All strings are translatable (without concatenation, handles plurals)
- [ ] Follows our naming conventions (P6rkRX-4oA-p2)
- [ ] Hooks (p6rkRX-1uS-p2) and functions are documented
- [ ] New UIs are responsive and use a [mobile-first approach](https://zellwk.com/blog/how-to-write-mobile-first-css/)
- [ ] New UIs match the designs
- [ ] Different user privileges (admin, teacher, subscriber) are tested as appropriate
- [ ] Code is tested on the minimum supported PHP and WordPress versions
- [ ] User interface changes have been tested on the latest versions of Chrome, Firefox and Safari
- [ ] "Needs Documentation" label is added if this change requires updates to documentation
- [ ] Known issues are created as new GitHub issues

pull_request.title: Add a progress table eraser tool
pull_request.body:
Resolves #5868 

## Proposed Changes

* Add a tool that deletes progress tables and quiz submission tables.

## Testing Instructions

1. Enable the feature flag. 
3. Make sure you have progress tables in DB. If not remove the `sensei-version` option from `wp_options` table and reload a page (it should run schema update and create tables).
4. Make sure you don't see the tool ("Delete student progress tables").
5. Disable the feature flag.
6. Take a course and submit a quiz to have some rows in tables.
7. Go to Sensei LMS > Tools.
8. Find `Delete student progress tables`, click "Visit Tool".
9. On the next screen, try to click "Delete Progress Tables" without giving your confirmation.
10. Must not delete tables, shows a warning.
11. Now check the confirmation and click "Delete Progress Tables".
12. Make sure tables were deleted.
13. Go to Tools and check the tool is not available. (You can see it, but the "Visit Tool" button is disabled.)

## Pre-Merge Checklist
<!-- Complete applicable items on this checklist **before** merging. Items that are not applicable can be left unchecked.

Both the PR author and reviewer are responsible for ensuring the checklist is completed. -->
- [x] PR title and description contain sufficient detail and accurately describe the changes
- [ ] Acceptance criteria is met
- [x] Decisions are publicly documented
- [ ] Adheres to coding standards ([PHP](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/php/), [JavaScript](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/javascript/), [CSS](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/css/), [HTML](https://developer.wordpress.org/coding-standards/wordpress-coding-standards/html/))
- [ ] All strings are translatable (without concatenation, handles plurals)
- [ ] Follows our naming conventions (P6rkRX-4oA-p2)
- [ ] Hooks (p6rkRX-1uS-p2) and functions are documented
- [ ] New UIs are responsive and use a [mobile-first approach](https://zellwk.com/blog/how-to-write-mobile-first-css/)
